text: 22oz bottle thanks to toby. Pours out black topped with a tan head. Nose is smoke meat some sausage oak notes some ash and black licorice. Taste is more of the nice smoke balance a meaty note very well done. I am not a smoke beer fan but this one was solid.

Intense smoked, bacon, savoury malts. Hazy, very dark brown, small, creamy, off-white head. Light sweet. Smoked malts continue, bacon, lightly salty, toasted, dark malts, caramel, sweet, savoury finish, soft carbonation, full bodied. Outstanding Smoked, very intense, nice sweetness in palate. Keg at the brewery, Minneapolis.

Tap - good size foamy head, black color, big BBQ smoke aroma that comes through moderately on the taste, mild roasty notes, mild Woody notes, pretty well balanced for a smoke beer, very good overall 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap into a snifer showing pitch black with sparse white foam on the edges. 

The nose first shows a lot of steel tank notes but eventually matures into light roasted malts then finishes with a very Islay peaty aroma (think swampy, smoked malt). 

The palate is well carbonated and light bodied but creamy and well done. The flavor is very peaty and swampy. Tastes more akin to a whiskey than a beer but without the hard alcoholic bite. Still very good though. I would hesitate to buy a whole bottle unless its shared.
Tap at the source. Pours black, small tan head. Aroma is smoke, wood, oak, chocolate, spot of licorice, roasted malt. Flavor is smoke, wood (oaky), chocolate. Some dark fruit. Nice.

Dark brown, almost black, pour. Outstanding head volume, quite outstanding retention and lacing. 

Rich Rauchbier style nose that is world class. Bacon cooking over a campfire aroma with emphasis on the wood smoke. Subtle notes of roast, molasses and dark fruit lurk underneath. As it warms, a light licorice note mingles with the campfire.

Medium body that is smooth in texture and has nice creamy aspects in the finish. Superb carbonation that has an effervescent tingle in the middle and a nice burst in the finish.

The flavor profile is world class, rich in complexity and extremely well balanced. This balance is exemplified by smoke not dominating the palate as was the case in the nose. Rising to balance, is a rich sweet base that is heavy caramel with very subtle hints of bakers chocolate. The middle hints at bitterness, but serves as the smoke / caramel battleground. As the middle fades, plum, fig and raisin flavors separate. The finish is preceded by a light licorice note just before the aged oak aspect arrives. The finish is a slow fade of smoke, caramel, oak, and a hint of alcohol that delivers a drying finish with a hint of heat.
On tap on St Pattys Day at the brewery -- this is a great smoked beer. Great flavor subtle smoke, just great.
Draught. Creamy off-white good mostly lasting head. Black colour. Heavy malty and moderate hoppy aroma. Heavy biter wonderfull smoked flavor. Creamy palate. Great stuff.
Tap @ Mikkeller bar, Aarhus. Blackish pour with a light tan head. Notes of smoke, campfire, caramel, dry wood, bitter chocolate and some light vanilla.

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar Aarhus. Pours dark reddish black with a medium offwhite head. Aromas of smoke, malts, chocolate, tobacco, light tar. Taste is smoky, oaky sweetness, cocoa, sweet chocolate, malty, dry ashy finish.

fra fad
duft: røget chokolade kaffe mørk ristet malt.
smag: røget rosin dadler svesker tobak ristet lidt chokolade dyb og fylding

Black pour, small off white head. Aroma is obviously smoky, earthy, lots of wood, hints of coffee, and some bitter cocoa powder. Mouth feel is thin, like I would expect from a lagered ale, with a soft carb. The finish is more woody smoke, notes of bacon come through with more earthy barrel and campfire. Low to medium bitterness and some soy in the end.

On tap at CBC15. Dark brown with tan head. Aroma is lightly smoked, coffee, roasted malt, dried fruit adn caramel. Taste is bitter, smoked, ash, tar, chocolate, with a bitter finish.

Im not a fan of smoke beer but this was pretty good. Bottle, Pours dark brown with tan head. Nose is smoke right up front with some coffee and caramel. Taste is mildly smokey. This would be a good introductory smoke beer.

May 2, 2015. On tap at CBC2015, red session.
Black with a small creamy tan head. Aroma is smoked wood, roasted malts, dark bread, licorice, chocolate, some toffee and coffee notes. 
Taste is medium sweet, soft bitter and a soft woody smokiness. Finish is sweet malty and smokey with toffee, dark bread, hints of dark fruits, licorice, light bitter roastiness with hints of toasted wood, 
Medium bodied, soft carbonation.

Pours black with a very minimal khaki head. There is a heavy smoky aroma that is complimented with coffee, licorice, chocolate, and hints of alcohol. The taste is focused more on chocolate, with some undertones of and alcohol, smoke, and earthy malts. Aftertaste is light, though it lasts a bit, and is a woody smoke. This one is medium in body, has a texture that feels a bit flat, and has softer carbonation. For a style I usually enjoy, I have to say Im disappointed. I expected more.

Waxed bomber poured a dark brown hue w/ large tan head. Big smoky aromas. Initial flavor is light sweet w/ a light bitter finish. Tastes are smoked bacon and toast. Full bodied.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hey look! I havent rated "Smoke" yet! 
Pours a very deep crimson, without bright lights the sucka looks black. Its got a tan head that is tight, medium sized and well retained. The lacing is nice. Grate lookin bier mydudes!
 The aroma is rich and smoky evoking smoked meats for sure, some sorta sweet glazed ham or something. Its got some nice vanilla and woodiness to it too. Generally speaking its real sweet smelling but I think given the sort of woody on smoky nose, that sweetness is a positive thing here. 
The flavor is really truly a delicious practice in balance. Its smoky for sure, its quite rich, ashy, and chocolaty. The roasty bitterness and light fruity character are the deviations that are best employed for balance here. As the beer warms both the vanilla like sweetness and wood come more and more forward, but so does some of the roasty bitterness. 

So often with smoked beers caution is thrown to the wind in the pursuit of smoked malt goodness... I love beers like that, but I also love this beer for transcending that.
bomber thanks to the Piggly Wiggly shirt wearing AndyReynolds. toast, floral, smoke, soy sauce, coffee, brown, red, tan foam, medium sweetness, full body, sticky, average carbonation,
750ml bottle of 2015 release. Pours a black color with a bit of head. Lots of smokey flavor that overpowers at first. Needs some time to breathe. Nice balance of smoke and hops.
On tap at Surly. Wow, this is great. Really nice and smoky, yet smooth and palatable. Tastes like a delicious complex brew underneath too - just great.

Brown bottle, 750 ml, savoured on September 17 2015; eye: liquorice, opaque, ring of brown head, no lacing; nose: smoke, malt, meaty, caramel; mouth: smoke, malt, meaty, caramel, smoky finale with good malty presence, medium-full body, average carbonation, rather sweet, slick texture; overall: fine

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 750 ml, échange avec Adam Conway, savourée le 17 septembre 2015; il : réglisse, opaque, anneau de mousse brune, pas de dentelle; nez : fumé, malt, viandeux, caramel; bouche : fumé, malt, viandeux, caramel, finale fumée avec bonne présence maltée, corps moyen-corsé, carbonatation moyen, plutôt sucrée, texture coulante; en résumé : bien

Tap; pours dark brown with a beige head; aroma is malt, dark fruits, smoke, and hints of wood; taste is chocolate, dark fruits, malt, and some smoke, wood, and caramel; finish is dry and smoky with a hint of roasted malt; very good smoked beer

Really nice deep smokiness in the aroma along with some smoked meatiness and heavily caramelized maltiness; Opaque, dark brown color with a thin beige head; sweet, toasted maltiness, tons of smoke and deep smoky maltiness, toasted raisin, licorice, black mission figs, higher alcohol is evident; medium body, smooth and tingly; quite good, deep and flavorful without being too smoky, quite enjoyable.

Pours a dark dark brown with a beige rim that leaves good lacing. Nose is of smoke, umami and roasted malt. Taste is of dark fruits, smoke and a little alcohol. Body is medium, carbonation moderate and I found it to be a little light for a baltic porter (personal preference). Overall a really nice smoked baltic porter, short of world class but not by much!

How: Bottle (750 ml). Shared at Mont-Carmel tasting. Bottle from John, thanks! At least 2 years old. 

>>> Complex and super tasty Smoked Baltic Porter that is really well preserved for a 2 + years beer.

-  Slightly hazy brown with a medium easy to revive beige head and some lacing. 
-  Nice mix of meaty smoke, roasted malts and dark fruits. 
-  The taste also have a nice caramel/molasses sweetness. 
-  Main flaw of the beer is that the body is a bit thin, especially for a 9.5 % abv beer. It might only be because of age though. 
-  It held up really well flavor-wise for a 2+ years Smoked. Absolutely no oxidation signs. 

Flavors:  Meaty smoke, roasted malts, dark fruits, molasses/caramel.

pours unclear dark brown with a very nice reviving light beige cap, nice lacing. dark roasted spiciness, tasty burnt grass, red fruitiness, lots of raisins and other dried sweetened dark fruitiness, buttered pecans, some sweetness - molasses; tasty wood, spices, clean. light carbonation, medium body - oily, semi-sweet and spicy finish. layers of smoke in a complex raisin-y baltic porter. very good stuff!

Bottle shared. Black pour with creamy white head. Aroma is nice and smoky, roasty, really nice balanced smokiness. Taste is nice and smoky, nice roasty flavor, somewhat rich, light molasses. Palate is med full bodied with good carbonation. Really nice.
Very good smoke beer, but missing the extreme smoke flavor of a Rauchbier from Bamberg. Smoke aroma that pours almost black with a nice tan head. sweet smoky flavor. sweet finish.

750 ml bottle into snifter, 2015 vintage bottling. Pours nearly opaque dark brown/black color with a 1-2 finger dense tan head with good retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Aromas of big chocolate, cocoa, coffee, wood smoke, toasted oak, caramel, brown sugar, light licorice, raisin, plum, fig, light char, light herbal, and roast/smokey earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of dark/roasted malt, smoke, and oak barrel notes; with good strength. Taste of big chocolate, cocoa, coffee, wood smoke, caramel, brown sugar, toasted oak, light licorice, raisin, plum, fig, light char, light herbal, and roast/smokey earthiness. Light herbal/roasted bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of chocolate, cocoa, wood smoke, toasted oak, caramel, brown sugar, and herbal/roasted earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roasted malt, smoke, and oak barrel flavors; with a great roasted bitterness/sweetness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Very clean on lager flavors with zero estery yeast notes present. Light-medium carbonation and medium-full bodied; with a very smooth, moderately creamy/silky, and slightly sticky/chalky mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a light warmth lingering after the finish. Overall this is an awesome smoked Baltic porter style. All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roasted malt, smoke, and oak barrel flavors; and very smooth and easy to sip on for the ABV. A highly enjoyable offering.

Aroma and taste is roasted malty, slight burnt dark malty notes, with chocolate, coffee, caramel, smoke, wooden nuances, nice.

Big wax sealed bottle of the 2015 vintage gifted to me by some awesome peeps. I have been trying to get my hands on this one for years and years. I wasnt sure what to expect and Im glad I got to drink down this bad boy. The pour is very dark with little ruby highlights and a long lasting khaki head. I wish there were more smoke in the aroma. The most prominent word on the label is "smoke" in all caps, so my expectations are for a heartily smoky beer. There are pleasant hints of dark fruits, chocolate, wood and far away cigars. The palate is robust, but not that huge considering the abv. Malty flavors dominate with timid fruity suggestions coming through. I dont get a ton of oak, but its there. The chocolatey malt profile melds nicely with smoky undertones. Personal tastes in beer are obviously widely subjective and varied. I enjoyed this beer a lot and its clearly well crafted. That being said, if I were in charge at Surly I wouldnt even put smoke on the label. I still like it though.

Draft. Dark brown/black with a small tan head. Aroma of smoked meats, vanilla, dark fruits, and chocolate. Medium body, chocolate, strong malt presence, dark fruits, and nice smoke undertones. A very nicely done smoked beer.

Bottle at RBWG 15 Grand Tasting @ Coppertail, thanks to whomever shared this one, 21/02/15.
Black with a moderate off white covering.
Nose is smoked malt, biscuit, toffee, light charr.
Taste comprises light cocoa, smoke a little more intense than on the nose, smoked meat, spice, nutty.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Solid smoked number.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Tap @ CBC 2015. Dark brown with a tan head. Aroma heavy malty (roasted, smoke, dark fruits, caramel, coffee, chocolate, licorice with woody and vanilla notes). Flavor medium sweet and bitter. Medium to full body.
Tap at CBC 2015, Copenhagen. Originally rated 20150502. Colour is black with brownish small head. Aromas and flavours: Smoke, some coffee and roasted malts.

@red cbc 2015
ham, medium smoke, wood, wonderful smoke taset, very balanced

Draught sample at CBC 2015. Dark brown colour with a dense, tanned head. Roasted aroma with smoke, fruits, caramel, coffee and herbal hops. Taste is lightly bitter. Medium to full body with a creamy texture. Finishes dry and roasted with smoky impressions. Lovely Smoker.

From tap at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2015, Red session. Dark brown color with light beige head. Roasted malty aroma, caramel, light chocolate, smoked. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma with coffee addition. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.
From a bottle into a glass. The pour is a dark ruby red with no head. The body is thin body with a raisins,bacon,slight salty taste. Its good.

Bottle. Dark dark brown with lasting tan head. Smokey woody leafy bready chocolate boozy vanilla aroma. Very sweet chocolate vanilla woody plummy booze with woody ashy smokey boozy finish. Full body rich creamy. Way too sweet for my tastes. I love smoked beers but I do not like Baltic porters (in general). Bad combo for me. Still, a good beer, but I was hoping for a new fave.
Tap @CBC15. Clear, very dark brown. Creamy beige head. Meaty smoke aroma. Similar flavor, sweetish with dry and bitter finish.

Sample at CBC 2015.

Black with a medium tan head. Nice aroma and taste of smoke, oak, chocolate, some coffee and dark fruit. The body was almost full and the carbonation low. Tasty.
Pours black with an off-white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour are salt, smoke, liquorice, and roasted malt - with a slightly bitter finish.
At CBC as Surly Smoke. Poured deep dark brown with a beige head. Aroma of moderately rauched malt, coffee and chocolate. Medium body, flavour is smoky and sweet berries, light ashtray.

750mL bottle (2015). Gotta admit, I must be attracted to shiny things as that silver wax looks pretty dope. Pours a deep, brownish-black (looks like a stout), espresso brownish head with very nice retention and lacing. Nose is a heavy hit of smokiness, roasted almonds, cocoa, more smoke. Mouth is medium bodied, silky, medium sweetness with a big fucking wallop of smoke over a base of raisins, chocolate, dark roasted coffee, hints of licorice, finishes with a bit of brine. Im not a huge fan of smoked beers -- and just an FYI the claim on the bottle that this is subtle is total bullshit... this is as smoky as a BBQ pit, and I already had been told beforehand -- however this one was better than some others Ive had. Surly is easily one of my favorite breweries.

Dark brown creamy head, lace. Milk chocolate, anise, dark fruit, smoke, toasted marshmallo, cherry chocolate. Same in taste but bigger than aroma, stronger toasted marshmello and smoke character. Balanced bitter sweet, a bit boozy, maybe big on anise too. 8.5% I believe. Full body, drinks kindof light and foamy despite some booziness, not that rich malty for its abv, but dry foamy. Oak, woody. Pretty good. Overpriced.

On tap at Bangers & Lace. Pours black with a nice tan head. Aroma is extremely smoky, quite like beef jerky; there is also some roasted malt notes. Taste is mildly sweet and quite dry with not much of a bitter presence to it. Medium body, soft carbonation, and almost creamy on the palate. Overall a really nice smoked beer, quite pleasant.

Bottle, from the reserve list at Stout Barrel House, shared with Parksy. Near black, brown head. Equal parts meaty smoke, sweet barrel traits, and chocolate, dark fruit undertones. Rich and complex. Excellent, but not worth the ridiculous price charged by this place.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Black pour with a tall, frothy tan head that eventually fades to a more manageable one finger, creamy tan head. Aroma is smoke, iodine, mild coffee, bittersweet chocolate, port simmered berries, roasted nuts, dark fruit, sweet yeasty wheat bread, a hint of pine shoots and a hint of pie crust. Flavor is sweet chocolate, smoke, roast, chocolate chip cookies, dark fruit, cherries, sweet, yeasty bread, light mineral, light iodine, light oyster-ish salinity and some spruce shoots. Medium to heavy body, creamy to slick, full feel, light to medium carbonation and slightly dry finish.

On tap, poured into an english tulip pint glass. The beer is dark and oily dark woth a rich cola hue and a light tan colored soap head that has a moderate retention and very light lace. The aroma is a smokey, charred note with roasted coffee beans, and a cookie dough hint with late developing aromas of vanilla and raisin. The taste is a medium high roasted sweet with a complimentary medium slick bitter. The beer is syrupy smooth with a soft fuzz carbonation and a medium full body with flavors of coffee and smokey grilled meats with some undertones of chocolate. It finishes sticky with mostly a spicy clove and coffee that carries to the aftertaste thats mostly clean with a smokey charred quality.

On tap at the brewery. Pour is clear brown with slight red tint and tan colored head - good lacing. Meat drippings, light vanilla, cocoa, some cookie malt, and earthiness in the aroma. Taste is big smoke, bacon, brown malty, some caramel and brown sugar. Thin body with soft carbonation. Tasty smoked beer.
Aroma is BBQ smoke and dark malts. The flavor is BBQ, fruit, dark malts and a mix of oak and acidity in the finish.

Poured in tap at surly brew pub

Very complex and interesting beer. 

Definitely hints of smoke and a great lingering aftertaste wanting you to take another sip. 

Ive been hesitant about buying the bottle, but this is another solid surly beer

2000 bottle thanks to Tim. Pours a cloudy amber with small beige head that diminishes to nothing. The aroma is strong smoke, pepper, and wood. Thin mouth, light malt, very strong smoke and pepper with lingering dryness, very good.
Smokey and delicious, coffee and molasses notes, hints of biscuit and light grain. Worth having!

Tasted during RBWG15 Grand Tasting. Black color. Thin off-white head, decent bits of lace. Good savory smokey taste, dark chocolate. Moderate to bigger sweet taste, moderate bitter. Light warmth. Awesome bigger chewy body, lighter carbonation, light slick. Very good smoked lager. Good chewiness to it.

Bottle at RBWG. Really nice rauchbier-baltic smoked beer. Smoky bacon and campfire over a nice sweet body. Maybe some fruit and vanilla flavors to balance out the smoke. Not too overpowering to drink like some smoked beer. Good stuff.
Draft - Sweet smoky and some pale malts. Deep brown with a decent beige head. Dark and smoky malty notes. Nice.
Bottle at RBWG GT. Nose is strong campfire and bacon, dried meat (drippings). Taste is a sweet, luscious smoke and meat. Reminds me of bamburg onions.
2013. Dark beer with a foamy beige head. Big sweet nose with lots of meaty smoke. Rich smoke flavors of bacon, molasses, brown sugar and honey baked ham. Really intense smokey beer.

Rate #997. Bomber from trade to glass. Unique beer that got better as it warmed and the more I drank. Slightest of smoke in aroma slight dark fruits and a couple other I couldnt quite identify. Mouthfeel was a 4. Nice carbonation. Different type of hop slight bitter finish. Taste is aroma and a little bit of roast. Good not great

22oz bottle in a tulip. Pours black with a beige head. Aroma of smoked malts, some roast, oak and vanilla, some light dough, notes of chocolate and coffee, and some light bitterness. Flavor the same with a nice blend of everything. Average to smoother texture. A solid beer for sure.
"An aggressively sour ale. Light in body, prickly. Berries, vinegar and oak are the main players in both aroma and flavor. Some lemony funk in the flavor as well. Really nice brew."

This is one magnificent lager. The smoked malts dominate this sucker without tasting burnt. Its black and thick like a good Baltic porter with a tall tan head. The aroma and the taste mingle perfectly.

Thanks to largadeer for opening this at the post-post-RS party tasting. Reviewed from notes. Poured into a taster glass.


A - Pours black with a very tiny mocha colored head leaving no lacing at all down the glass.


S - Good amount of roasted malts up front but the smoke is not far behind. Some nice chocolate and vanilla sweetness comes thru as the smokey darkness begins to let up. Just o.k. really.


T - Plenty of dark roasted malts in this one. A nice mix of chocolate and coffee flavors starts to break thru once the smokey malt dies down a bit. The smoke is quite pronounced as you might expect and never really leaves the party. Not too bad but nothing mind blowing here.


M - Medium-Heavy body and flavors with moderately low carbonation. A bit light in the feel with tons of lingering smokey dark roast in the finish.


D - Decent stuff. I enjoy porters quite a bit but this one was just too smokey to really enjoy. I could drink one of these but that is about it.

Pours a bubbly burnt umber color with a finger or two of khaki foam. Nose is a mix of light cocoa dust, vanilla, some dark fruit and smoked malts. Palate follows with nice layers of oak character that mingles nicely with smoked malts and the base cocoa flavors. Nice roast character and well balanced.

Dark brown in color... Aroma of smoked malts, oak, sausage... Flavor is incredibly smooth, light mouthfeel, but big smokey flavor with big notes of oak, candi sugar, tobacco, leather... Great beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Had thanks to my boy Weasel. Nice dark thick color. Aroma and taste dominated of smokey bbq tones. If you like smokey beers I recommend giving it a try. Best way to describe this is drinking a nice rub off a rack of ribs.

beige head disappears quickly without lacing. coffee coloured. aroma is smoke, leather, coffee, candysugar, booozy. taste like aroma with long coffeebitter finish. medium body, quite carbonated. very nice balance and complexity. lovely!  bottle 65 cl

06.06.2014, 0,65l bottle (2013 vintage, bottle #1363) @ home:
Nice light brown creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is lightly smoked dark malts, hay, shed, smoked ham, licorice, grass, hints of unripe banana. Taste is slightly sweet, dark malts, sugar, shed, smoked ham, hay, grass, grain, hints of licorice and coffee. Medium bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Nice.
Bottle at Culmination Fest: Poured a black with tan head. Aroma was very smokey. Taste was weird mix of smoke and roasted malts.

Near black with thick foamy brown head. Aroma- touch of smoke along with some slight fruitiness. Taste - sweet malt with caramel, brown sugar, roasted malt and cream. Prominent but not overpowering smoked malt. Nice smoked lager.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle... Poured dark, not fully black though, with an ok forming head. Aroma of charred, smoky grains. Awesome toasted malt, burnt sugar, and smoked flavors. Hint of barrel to round it all out.
75 cl bottle @ home. Pours black with an off-white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour are salt, smoke, liquorice, and roasted malt - with a slightly bitter finish.

Tap at Mikkeller & Friends, Copenhagen. Black with a thin ring of brown head. Aroma of bacon-like smokiness. Strong, malty, molasses-like taste. Smoke doesnt dominate but fills in around the edges. Sweet and sugary to some extent. Undercurrent of blackcurrant fruitiness. Certainly one of the better smoked beers Ive had.

2013 vintage, draft. Pours very dark. Aroma is lovely: light smoke, prunes, plums, chocolate, whiskey. Deep and complex, no alcohol. Taste is smooth and round dark chocolate mousse, oak, smoke, berry-like fruitiness. Age as been kind to this one. Impressive.

Well balanced smoke but not a huge amount of body here. Pours black with good head and lacing with small mocha tint. A little burnt on the initial taste. Chocolate, finishes bitter. Tap takeover at Churchkey.

4 ounces on draft at ChurchKey during the SAVOR Surly event. Pours a dark brownish black with tan head. Aromas of smoke, tobacco, chocolate. Tasting notes of smoke, roast, malts, tobacco, light chocolate. Medium-full body with a dry finish.

Bottled. Pours deep brown nearly black with an average, tan
head. Aroma of slightly roasted malt, vanilla, wood and caramel.
Sweet flavor that ends up more dry with bitter notes. An excellent brew.

Draught @ Mikkeller & Friends, Copenhagen. Pours a black colour with a small head. Aroma of smoked wood, grass and malts. Flavour of smoked malts, tart-ish wooden notes, mild bitterness and cream. Medium bodied and a bone dry mouthfeel. Dry, malty, toasted finish. Good.

Draught @ Mikkeller & Friends, Copenhagen

Pours pitch black with a smooth head. Aroma of wood, oak, ash, mild smoke and roastiness. Taste is sweet, syrupy and woody with some oak, vanilla and smoke. Finish is sweet, stuffy and mildly smoky with some woody syrupy notes. Okay a bit unbalanced

Tap @ Mikkeller & Friends.
Pours dark brown color with a small head. Smoky and malty aroma, mild wooden notes also. smoky and malty flavor also, some fruity notes with hay on the finish. Decent.
4324

Draught @ Mikkeller & Friends. Aroma is rather light with some toffee and slight smoky tones. Flavour has toffee, smoke notes, some grilled meat and sweetish tones. Like Schlenkerla Urbock, but not that smoky. And like urbock, this becames somewhat sticky after some sips, which reduces drinkability.
Dark brown/black color; Medium creamy body; Aroma of toasted malt, dark chocolate, & campfire; Flavor of roasted/smoky sweet malt, caramel, hops, and dark chocolate; Quite good.

2012 bottle based on the stamp in the wax; 8.2% ABV. Some rust along cap, but there was a hiss when it opened. 
Aroma has a moderate smoke character, but ii is not completely overwhelming. Light chocolate character is noticeable with some faint dark fruit character. 
Pours dark brown, almost black but not quite completely opaque along the edges. Fairly large, moderately thick, light mocha head that exhibits pretty good retention. Light lacing and fairly small legs. 
Flavor has a nice sweetness that goes well with the moderate chocolate notes that are upfront. Light roast mid palate helps welcome in a medium light smoke character that lingers a bit in the finish with some dark chocolate. Light dark fruit notes of plum, prune and fig along with some faint dark caramel and toffee notes.
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation and has a nice silky, creaminess to it. Low astringency and medium low alcohol warmth. 
Overall a very nice smoked beer that has aged surprisingly well. The smoke character doesnt overwhelm the underlying beer so the rich chocolate notes, dark fruit and caramel have a chance to show through.
Tap at Woolleys. Deep brown with some tan lacing. Smokey, leather, dried leaves and earthy hops. Taste is dry with light bitterness. Body is lighter with a foamy feel.
Bottle from Chase! Pours a thin black with low head. Aroma is roasted malt with smokey oak. Taste is bitter roast with a salty ham finish, nice, but im not a big smoke guy
Black pour from bottle at home. Very smokey. I like this style but not finding many others that do. Earthy malty notes on a big stouty smoke pile
Served in a bulb glass, very pillowy mocha head. Deep ruby in color and a mellow feel in the mouth. Tastes of an open wood fire with chocolate and toffee notes. I am a fan.

Bottle, thanks Chase! Opaque black pour. Robust smoky aroma with notes of dark chocolate. Medium mouthfeel, with smokiness being the predominant up front flavor that gives way to a robust dark malt backbone.

750ml grey wax bomber from the Art of Beer, cellared for about a month. Pours an inky black with a rapidly disappearing brown head. Seems quite carbonated when swirling but also headless. Aroma has thick meaty smoke, and also chocolate, caramel and some pitted fruits. Taste is of sweet caramelly malts and rich salty smoky meat, with some subtle chocolate and some light fruitiness. Full bodied, quite strong and luscious. Finishes somewhat sweet and also bitter/salty, with a lot of length. Lotta personality and depth to this one as it went down through the glass. Really enjoyed it. Bought it completely on the Surly name - and paid a pretty price for it. Price - value ratio .... shrug? It was good.

Tastes like drinking a smokey scotch. Really dark in Coe and has a bold alcohol flavor. You have to like scotch to enjoy this one. Had at world of beer 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
2012 bottle. Pours cola brown. Nice roasty aroma. Flavor is smoky goodness and charred meat. Well rounded and quite good.

Rich and creamy, with a strong smokey nose of bacon fat and pepperoni. Sweet black fruits fill out the palate and add contrast along with a candy sugar edge over the malty roasted cocoa underbelly, with complex smoked meat nuances lingering. Layered and multi-dimensional.
Pours black with smoky aromas and flavors. Some nice woody bitterness as well. Nice smoked Porter.
Pitch black Smoky aroma but the flavour is smooth and balanced with bubblegum sweetness. Quite a nice beer and not killer smokey like some rauchbier.

Purchased at Binnys in Chicago, IL; enjoyed at home alone relaxing prior to the NYE holiday. This was an $18 bottle and I was hesitant to get it, but Im happy that I did. Appearance is a murky pitch black with a rich but quickly dissipating tan head. Aroma is fantastic...oak, smoke, chocolate, and vanilla, its rich but not potent. Taste is equally fantastic. I feel like the oak takes away the harshness of the smoked malt but retains a nice flavor, mixed with the chocolate and vanilla. There is a licorice element in this as well. Overall its pretty great and Im happy that Ive had it. Very happy that Surly is in Illinois!

This is the most delicious smoked beer Ive ever had. The aroma as well as the flavor are nice and smokey. Thick foam head that lasts. This is a well balanced smoked lager with a bold smoked flavor, yet balanced with a tasty sweet finish. Give it a try!

Refrigerated 75 cl brown bottle obtained from BVery with wax on the cap. Pours black with medium dark brown highlights with medium light brown head. Aroma is roasty with some smoke, medium body, medium carbonation, and big bubble lacing. Taste is roasty, smoke, and some pepperoni. Hoped for a little more flavor, alcohol is well covered, and is not as heavy as I expected.

A deep dark lager with a thin mocha head. In aroma, a peaty chocolate malt with light smokey notes, not bad. In mouth, a nice sweet dark fruity malt with light peated notes, molasses, alcohol warmth, very nice. On tap at End of Everything beer fest Dec 22 2013.

Pours black, two finger tan head.

Smell roasty ash, grainy

Taste light roast, table pepper, smoaky roast

Lighter body

Solid

Go surly band wagon... I believe ive had a majority of their didnt beers, but I think my favorite is pentagram and even that is sub par. This tastes like a bonfire threw up in your mouth, and not in a good way. Ive tried this twice and right the same thing, not worth the money.

There is nothing wrong with the appearance or aroma, but this could be the most disgusting beer ever made. At a beer tasting, 9 out of 10 tasters considered this beer the worst beer ever made. The only discussion over this beer was what purpose it could serve. Possible solutions are beer batter, base for BBQ sauce, or marinade.

Bottle, thnx to Secret Summer Santa, shared with the crew. Pours a pitch black beer without any head on top. The little amount that is there, is forced by pouring aggresively. No light shining trough this beer. Aroma is smoke, barbecue, caramel, malts and vanilla. Flavor is sweet with a dash of smoke in the background, making it feel very subtle and easy going. Mouthfeel is a bit thin, but that must be the lager influences I guess. Touches of vanilla and raisins in the very finish of the flavor. Very well crafted, balanced brew! Great!

Bottle courtesy of MrHangover to celebrate Deansos 4000th rating! Poured a deep mahogany colour with a frothy tan head. The aroma is fruit, syrup and caramel. The flavour is medium bitter with a creamy liqourice alcohol palate. Medium bodied with low carbonation and an oily texture. A lager, someone is having a laff :-) A really superb beer!

66cl bottle courtesy of and shared with MrHangover, big thanks.
Smokey aroma. Very thin off white head. Clear deep burgundy pour. Smokey aftertaste with a little sweetness.

Dark brown color, small beige head. Licorice and smoke in the nose. Medium-bodied. Licorice, caramel, some light hops. Sweetish, very pleasant.

Sampled at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2013 - Day 2, Session 2. Pours dark brown with a creamy, tan head. Classic rauchbier nose, all smoked ham and minerals. Medium sweet flavor with robust smoked malts, candied ham, caramel sugars. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Sweet finish with good smokiness and further candied ham. Great stuff.

A: Dark Opaque Hue, Passes Almost No Light, Off White Head Ring, Some Lacing

S: Smokey, Woody, Mild Bacon

T: Smokey, Woody, Bacon

M: Decent Carbonation, Medium to Full Bodied, Smokey

Overall, this is a smokey beer and comes off exactly as that, not liquid smoke but more like a campfire.

2010 bottle with a freakin wax seal on a capped bottle! This is exactly what I guessed: a smoke Baltic porter. Great base beer with the smoke adding some complexity. I didnt really get much from the barrel treatment but the base beer was great. Also, no clue that this hovered around 9.5 ABV. Very well made.
Sampled at GABF 2013. Dark brown with a beige head. Smooth smoky porter with roast, oak, caramel and light vanilla.

Bottle, Thanks Jim! Pours dark ebony with a small tan head that dissipates quickly with some lacing. Aroma is smoke, roasted malts, tobacco. Flavor is the same, light sweet, little bitterness, light astringence from the oak. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel. Nice beer.
Draft at Surly during RBSG grand tasting. From notes. Loads of roasty malt with a good deal of smoke. This went great with the Pizza Luce dinner. Awesome.
@RBSG-Minnion tap-rich lt brown-black. A-smoke/peat/roasty-dk malt. T-smoke/peat/anise/roasty-sweet dk malt, earthy hop bite.

Draught at the Surly Taproom. Sweet chocolate and smoky nose, somewhat phenolic. Dark brown with ruby highlights. Initial is mostly chocolate / mid gets very sweet and the phenolic notes come out again / finishes with a sort of plastic-like chocolate note. Okay. But maybe more smoke would be better.
CBC 2013. Pours black with a small tanned head. Aroma is smokey malty roasted a bit salty ham. Flavor is fruity smokey slightly roasted a bit sweet bitter.

Dark brown pour at Surly during RBSG. Thick tan head, lots of lacing. Nice mouthfeel, full with ought being viscous. Subtle smoke accentuates the bitterness and wood character. This makes me want BBQ.

Bottle. Black with a tan head. Aroma is roast and sweet malt with light smoky notes. Taste follows suit and adds some umami. Palate is medium with a solid carb. The smoke is nice and light which makes this one more enjoyable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sample at CBC 2013. 

Dark brown colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, spice and smoke.

Dark pour. subdued aroma - smokey, but not overpowering. Lighter smoke allows more of this lagers qualities to shine through - Toffee, chocolate, roasted malt, nuts. Smooth mouthfeel, low carbonation. Probably the easiest drinking smoked beer Ive ever had.
On tap at Mikkeller and friends. Sweet and dry. Aromas of smoked malts and chocolate. Also aromas of toffee. Full flavoured. Medium bodied. Medium to off carbonation.

Bottle to taster. Black pour slight head. Aroma of smoke and ham. Like canadian bacon cooked over a campfire. Body is pretty thin. Liked it more at first but the more i had the less i enjoyed. Decent stuff but make sufe you split the bottle with several people.

Draft @ CBC 2013. Pours a dark brown almost black color with a small off-white head. Has a slightly roasted malty smoky aroma. Roasted malty grainy spicy smoky flavor. Has a roasted malty spicy smoky finish.

Draught, 9.5%. Surprisingly little aroma. Almost black colour, seems hazy. The flavour is sweet and salty at first, then it turns vinous with a mild bonfire smoked note. Subtle smoke, but still comes forward.
Fad: Sort klar øl med et fint skumhoved. Duften er overdreven bacon som også går igen i smagen. Heldigvis er der masser af malt til at bakke den fede smag og duft op med. Lækker øl.

Tap at Mikkeller & Friends. Deep reddish hazy brown with a small, creamy, beige head. Nose is more smooth burned than roasted, smooth, sweet and caramel malty with a soft smokey note. Sweet, ashy, chocolately, light citrussy taste, low carbonation. Not much intensity going on. Nothing to match the initial sweetness of the dark makts. Still not impressed by the skills of Surly. But a nice smokey nose, none the less.

Tap @ Mikkeller and Friends, Cph. Pours deep red to black with a small, creamy, beige film head. Aroma has light smoke, somewhat stale, dark chocolate, nuts, soft roasted. Low carbonation, fine dry and light creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has firm roasted malts, dark chocolate, affirmative smoke, fairly sweet. Lingering malty bitter finish. A bit simple and brash really.

Tap @ CBC 2013. The pours deep brown with a light off-white head. The aromas of smoked ham, red fruits. Mild wood, hints of lemon. The taste is more ham, mild smoke. Creamy malt, a bit of biscuit. Caramel sweetness. A touch of berry on the finish. Soft roasted malt. Nice, sweet smokiness. Good balance. Medium body, assertive carbonation. Overall, very solid.

Draught @CBC 2013. Pours near black with a tan small head. Aroma is smoke, caramel, roasted malt and sausage. Taste is moderate sweet and bitter. Body is medium+, texture is  oily, carbonation is soft.. Finishes dry with dark malt and warming alcohol.

Copenhagen Beer Celebration.
Tap, 040513.
Black with beige head. Aroma of smoke and roasts. Flavor with coffee, liqourice and some caramel

CBC. Black with a big, lasting and dense light brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, wood and smoke - bonfire. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and roasted moderate bitter finish. 040513
750 ml. bottle.  Pours almost black with a nice tan head.  Aroma of malt, smoke, chocolate, and ham.  Taste is roasted malt, smoke, chocolate, ham, and wood.  Unique for sure.  Glad I tried it.
Tap @ CBC. Black with small tan head. Aroma is roasted malts, smoke, little meat and chocolate. Flavour is roasted malts, smoke, meidum sweet, little meat, caramel, wood, hop and a little bitter.

[5/4/13] Draught at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2013. Dark brown to black color with a big beige head. Roasty and smoky aroma with meaty notes. Flavor of smoked and roasted malt, a bit of chocolate, hints of licorice and a bitter alcoholic finish. Medium-bodied.
Sample @ CBC. Nice head with good duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are caramel, wood, vegetables, smoke, malt and hops.

Draught @ CBC2013. Pours hazy black with a beige head that leaves a small trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is slightly sweet and slightly malty with roasted malts, charred wood, smoke, dark roast coffee, butterscotch hardcandy, bitter chocolate, moist soil and hints of peat. Taste is sweet, bitter and malty with roasted malts, smoke, charred wood, peat, dark roast coffee, bitter chocolate, salty liquorice, moist soil, burnt cookies and hints of burnt caramel and butterscotch harcandy. Mouthfeel is round, soft and medium to full bodied. Finish is slightly sweet, bitter and slightly malty with roasted malts, dark roast coffee, smoke, charred wood, bitter chocolate, hay and hints of smoked salmon. Very tasty...
On tap at CBC. Black colour with white head. Smoke aroma, with hints of hops. Smoked, roasted taste, slightly hoppy and bitter. Light body.

Draught at CBC 2013, cons 2013-05-04 Cophenhagen 
AR: mild smoke
AP: dark brown, stouthy beige head
F: sausages, wee vanilla, watery, a bit hollow feeling, chilli?
Fat på CBC 2013. Mörk, syrlig och söt baltisk porter med medelstor rökighet. Fruktig, vanilj, mjölchoklad, karamell, ek lite lakrits. Komplex och ganska lätt för stilen utan kärv beska. Gott
Fat på CBC 2013. Smak och doft av choklad, karamell, frukt med toner av rök, laktris och vanilj. Bra beska med toner av grape och örter.
Tap at CBC 2013.  Pours almost black with a big beige head. Aroma of smoke, roast, light chocolate and light licorice.  Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter.  Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Smokey notes dominates. Mouthfeel so light for an high alcohol brew. Some grassy hoppy bitter finish. Great.

Draught at CBC 2013. Black beer with a beige head. Smoked aroma, fruity, roasted, hay, caramel, biscuits, grassy, some bread. Smoked flavor, caramel, hay, roasted, chocolate, cocoa powder, licorice, some biscuits, floral notes. Really good.

Draught. Clear deep brown liquid with medium light tan head. Aroma of smoke, wood, fire, chocolate, bread, pumpernickel, licorice and light coffee. Taste is dry and medium bitter with notes of smoke, biscuit, chocolate and licorice. Medium bodied with medium carbonation.
Bottled with Ryan, Ray, Chris, et al. Pours a deep brown with tan head. Nose of roasted malt, smoke, mild chocolate. Medium body. A little sweet with moderate smoke.

Pitch black with a brown head and some mild lacing. The nose has some oak, smoked ham, chocolate and roasted malt notes. The palate is more of a heavyweight with some mild to moderate carbonation, but has sort of a smooth texture. Its not as smokey or rich as say other Rauchbiers out there but its definitely more balanced in terms of flavor.

Poured from a bomber into tullip glass. Pours a dark dark brown color with a light tan head which leaves great lacing.  Aroma is dry of chocolate, roasted malt, smoke. Flavor is a nice caramel, smoke, roasted malt and sweet. With a lingering sweet alcoholic finish. Mouthfeel is full and carbonation is above average. This is an absolutely delicious beer.

On tap @ Muddy Pig.  Looks jet black with decent head and decent lacing.  Aroma is campfire and hickory smoked bacon.  This is a unique smelling beer. I mean, its what I came for, but in the end it didnt agree with me as much as I hoped it would.
750ml bottle (2012). Pours a dark brown almost black color with a fingers worth of tan head. Aroma is belgiany and smokey. Taste is roasted malts, slight coffee, and smokey campfire.

Comfortable smokey aroma and dark pour with a balanced taste and warming mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Poured dark brown min head. Bacony smoke aroma. Oaky smoke flavor with malts. Very smooth.

Shared at Founders KBS release. Smells of malts. Tastes like hickory smoked bacon. Yumm. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very smokey and not much else honestly but still good. Sweet with a nice creamy texture. Kinda fruity and raisiny. Decent but I kinda wish it wasnt so strong as it does not have flavor to match.
On draft at ChurchKey DC during the Craft Brewers Conference.  Pours black with a tan head.  Smoky aroma.  Toasted oak flavors.  Quite rich for a lager.  NIce.
toast, earthy, coffee, Dark brown , medium sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, creamy, long finish, bitter,

22oz bottle shared by MrPickles.  Firmly entreched in Rauch, but also has the depth of the Baltic Porter tones.  Big specialty malt tones.  Woody, nutty, smoky cherry malt tones.  Mellow in mouthfeel despite the sugary richness.

Bottle from portableparty.  Deep, dark cola brown pour with khaki head.  Nose is a nice mix of salty smoke and sweet cherry-type smoke along with refined roast malt, cocoa powder, and faint fruit esters.  Flavor is a gentle salty/sweet smoke mix, bittersweet chocolate, soft roasted malt, and some mild dark fruit.  Lingering bittersweet chocolate, and to a lesser extent, charcoal.  A nice smoked porter, but not very Baltic.

750mL bottle, pours black with a small tan head. Aroma of moderate smoked malts, some vanilla, cocoa, and some roasted malts. Flavour of fairly intense smoke, roasted malts and cocoa. The smoke becomes a lot mellower the more you drink. Easily drinkable and smooth on the palate. No hint of the 9.5% ABV. Good stuff.

400th rating, and a good one for it.  750ml into a snifter.  pours a deep brown with frothy tan head.  aroma is smoke and roasted malt, some peat.  Tastes of coffee, roasted malt, smoke.  Nicely balanced.  Excellent.

Wonderful barrel-aged porter. Deep black pour with minimal froth. At first, there is a bourbony flavor, which goes downs bit hot. Afterwards, a really nice smokiness lingers that turns out to have been around the entire time. Aroma is a feint smokiness as well -- almost liquid smoke like. This is BBQ in a bottle!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2012 bottle. Pitch black, with a white/smokey white head. Aroma is smoke malts, campfire smoke like, roasted, sweet malts, some vanilla. Taste follows the nose almost perfectly. The way the smoke flavors mingle with the malt characteristics is extremely well balanced. Nice slightly dry finish. Overall for me almost as good as Left Hands Smokejumper, but extremely well done! Cheers!

2012 Bottle. Pours a dark brown, almost black with ruby legs and a medium, foamy, tan head and some lacing. Aroma is caramel malt, raisins, plums, and some woody smokiness. Several layers of flavor noted: caramel malt with chocolate, molasses, and brown sugar; sweet dark fruit including plums, dates, figs, raisins, and berries; and some nice but not overpowering smokiness with oak and meatiness, almost bacon flavors. Medium body with good carbonation and some alcohol noticeable but fitting. Great brew all around.

UPDATED: SEP 16, 2014 ABV: 8.2%. StFun supplied from his cellar giveaway. Many thanks! Tried on my pre-birthday bash (..."a very merry unbirthday... to me? TO YOU!"). To snifter it pours a dark purplish brown with virtually zero head at all, just bubbles and a thin line of foam is the only thing which seems to stop someone from asking if this is indeed a beer. Has some decent lace, however. Aromas of fudge, caramelized raisins, brown sugar, peanut brittle, and a faint yet unmistakeable ash characteristic. Cant smell too much oak, however. Tastes bittersweet and earthy with notes of grape skins, liquid coffee, black olives,  American yeast, smoke and stale Pepsi. Licorice, hops, and soil by swallow. Very thin but slushes around nicely in your mouth. Interesting. Not the best Ive had from Surly. I had such high hopes.

12 bottle.  Black pour with a tan head.  Aroma is light somke with char and bacon over soft chocolate and sweet malt.  Taste is mild smoke over chocolate and a sweet doppelbock type malt profile.  Bit mild for a baltic porter but the smoke treatment is nice.  Good beer.

Wow. I absolutely loved this beer. I want more. It pours black with a decent tan head. The aroma is burnt bacon, light peat and wood, some cocoa and mild soy sauce saltiness. The flavor is very smoky and dry with hints of wood smoke, molasses, bacon and dark fried fruit. Perfect on the palate, not too thick or thin. Perfect balance of salty smoke and sweet cocoa and bacon. An absolute pleasure to drink. I really wish this was easier to come by.
Not really sure where the smoke elements end up in this brew but it is nice and tasty. Lots of malt and a great palate.

Bottle.  Cocoa malt and light smoke aroma.  Dark brown with small head.  Sweet smoky chocolate malt flavor with a lightly bitter herbal hops finish.  Not bad but expected more flavor from a Baltic porter.

Pours a black color, with thin tan head....Smells of a smoked meat shop....applewood smoked meat...taste is the perfect amount of smokiness and meat smoked flavor, with some fresh home made deer sausage this is a gem....

Bottle: &nbsp Nearly black, thin sudsy beige head, spotty lacing. &nbsp  Beautiful smoked meat on the nose. &nbsp No band-aid at all. &nbsp Smells great! &nbsp Sweet smokiness up front, nice and smooth. &nbsp Wished it had a bit more body, but being as clean as it is I cannot complain. &nbsp Slight roastiness and dark chocolate too. &nbsp Really nice. &nbsp Lingering smoked malts and meat on the tongue. &nbsp This is great! &nbsp Not overly smoked like so many others. &nbsp Nice balance. &nbsp ABV is well hidden. &nbsp Good stuff!

Most Baltic porters have a similar flavor, but Surly has managed a unique brew with this one.  The addition of smoke fits in nicely; something I rarely like, but do in this beer. Tasty! Strong beer, so not a session ale.
Deep smoky flavor. Meaty and mouthwatering. Strong flavor . Definitely a sipping beer. Nice
Had this on tap at Darkness Day right at the brewery.  More smokiness than I expected, but great beer.  Just tough to drink it right after Darkness...

Bottle courtesy of mashmaster. Fruity smoked meat aroma - sort of like an applewood smoked ham. Deep mahogany with a small tan head.  Woody smoke, smoked meat, molasses, dark fruit flavor with a bit of a campfire finish. Full body, moderate carbonation. Pretty darn tasty.
Good smokiness on this one. Smoke dominates the baltic porter. Slight oak but not much.
This one is a smoke bomb. Nice sweetness, but for my taste way too much smoke and really thick. Tastes like a campfire. Good in a small portion.

UPDATED: MAY 6, 2013 First ratingSampled at GABF on Saturday October 13, first sessionBlack color, brown head. Sweet, smoke scent. Sweet, smoke taste. Metallic aftertaste. Poured from a 750ml bottle into a tasting cup.

A: Pours a very dark brown, almost black, with a bubbly wood chip colored head that subsides into some nice sticky lace down the glass.

S: Im picking up some smokey meat rinds and oak. There is roasted malts and a slight coffee.

T: The taste is a lot like the nose, but a lot more smokey. Smells of the embers of a campfire, very woody. Just toasted malts and smoke.

M: Medium bodied with a decent carbonation. Went down pretty smooth and left a light campfire in my mouth.

O: This was a very interesting brew. I wish there were some other flavors that could popped up, but the smokiness really took over and dominated. I guess thats why they call it Smoke.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 09-05-2011

Strong smoked meat smell and taste, very dark pour. Have had it as a sample at beer fests and also out of a few different bottles. Not something I would drink a lot of on my own, but I like the smoked meat flavor. This has a sweetness to it that I rather enjoy.

Really amazing stuff.  Smoked meat but meshed well with rich dark fruity characteristics that keep things from being too Schlenkerla-esque.  Much easier to drink than other smoked beers Ive had, at least out of the ones that taste very smoky.  Also has a really good, sticky mouthfeel.
Bottle.  Thanks to bnielsen13 for the bottle.  Pours a black color with a tan head.  Roasted, sweet aromas with hints of smoke.  Burnt, smoky, nutty, toffee flavors.

Black with no head.  Super smokey aroma with some malt.  Taste is sweet with tons of smoke.  Something about the combination of sweetness with smoke really disgusted me.  If the beer was drier I would have totally dug the smoke flavor but with this weird sweetness I cant take it.

22 oz. bottle shared with nebeergal on 19 Aug 2012. Got this bottle in a trade. Used a lager glass. Color was black with small brown head that faded quickly. Not much lace or retention. Nose is smoked ham and campfire. Taste is predominantly oak and smoke. With nice rounded semi-sweet malts of molasses, roasted malt and figs.
Average carbonation with a light oily to sticky mouthfeel. The lager yeast helps the body not be so big, sticky and sweet. Overall; I never drink this style of beer, it just really isnt my thing. However, this was drinkable and didnt overwhelm me (too much). I was objective as much I possibly could be for a style I dont like.

75cl, at 8.2%Vol, exclusive American brew, thx to Secret Santa!, complex smoked Porter, smoked/spicy and slightly roasted/sweet, not too heavy, balanced, hazy, small head, very good Winter brew, yet very expensive!

Bottle at BCTC. Dark brown to black. No head. Smells like a campfire. Taste is sweet and charred oak. Peppers and more burnt wood. Not much balance to this as well. im getting some pecans on the back end. Very chewy and peetie

Bottle, 22oz, at RBNAG-11. An unclear, brown beer topped by a small, light beige head. Ham-like notes in the aroma, roasted, and with some caramel and dried fruits. Some bitterness towards the end of the flavor, with ham, roasted notes, caramel and dried fruits. Full body. A bit too much on the ham-side this one, sort of unusual, and also quite nice. 111015

Poured from 750 to Surly coffee mug, 2011 vintage:

Pours a near pitch black with two fingers of light brown head that lasts a few minutes before receding to a collar that produces some average lacing.

Still a shit load of smoke on the nose. Not nearly is faded as Id imagined. A bit of dark fruit and woody character as well.

While the nose is still pretty beefy, the smoke has faded considerably on the tongue which is what I was hoping for. various brown ale qualities have surfaced to balance out the aggressive barbecue profile.

Overall, an extremely unique beer. Not my favorite beer from Surly but it definitely showcases their creative potential.
Sample from bottle.  Dark brown pour, thin head.  Smoke dominates this beer, campfire, burnt wood, bacon, background flavors of roasted malt, and dried fruit.  An enjoyable smokey beer.

Shared at my tasting on May 29, 2010. Thanks Paul! Review from notes.

A: This beer appears a very dark brown, almost black. There is virtually no head or lace at all.

S: Whoa - the aroma is extremely smoky. I guess this is what they were going for.

T: This tastes much more like a rauch bier than a Baltic Porter, incidentally. While there are some nice flavors here, the body is just too thin to support the complexities of this beer.

M: There is very little carbonation, and a generally flat feel.

D: Im glad I tried it, but I can get an Aecht Schlenkerla rauch bier that tastes better for way less trouble.
Extremely smooth and creamy mouthfeel, with a signficant and controlled smokey taste, with the porter complexty behind it. Thanks Mista.
bottle thanks dalze alez. pours black with pillow white head. aroma of bacon. mmmm bacon. taste is not overly smokey which i liked. semi sweet and some chocolate. best smoked ive had

Bottle at Savor.  This was my first beer from this brewer.  I really enjoyed it!  Flavor has the smoke all over it, but its not overpowering.  Alcohol is well hidden.  Very well balanced, would drink again if I can find it.

Tasted on 6/8/2012 at SAVOR 2012.  Pours a dark black, aroma is a lot of smoke yet taste isnt as aggressive. Didnt realize it was 9.5%, felt that with the taste and light-medium body I could have this for awhile. Really enjoyed it.  My first Minnesota beer and rating!...of course, Coffee Bender was enjoyed 5 minutes later.

Very impressed by this one.  Manages to be quite smoky yet balanced and lgiht and drinkable.  No clue it was near 10%, i would have guessed 5 or 6.  

Pours almost black, carbonated, but with little head.  Nose and front of the palate are pretty smoky, and give way to a roasty light body with a very clean and quick finish.  Definitely worth a try, very unique and very good.

Bottle. Pours a really dark brown color with a tan head. Aroma is of smoked malts, lots of smoked pork aromas like bacon, sausage and ham, some subtle oak, dark fruits, roasted malt, campfire notes, burnt wood and subtle vanilla. The flavor follows the nose with lots of smoke flavors of burnt wood, smoked pork, ham, sausage and bacon, roasted malt, dark fruits, roasted malt, oak and vanilla. The body is on the full side of medium with a creamy mouth feel. Overall a really tasty Smoked Baltic Porter!

A - pours deep dark opaque cola with fluffy high tan head. S - strong aromas of a quad. Some smoke, dark fruit, molasses, salted toasted caramel, chocolate, toffee. M - nice rich full bodied brew, strong creamy palate. T - smoke, roasted malts, coffee notes up front. Lightly bitter vegetal dark toasted malts, molasses on the palate. Lingering vinous smoke, coffee, and malts. O - very good smoke beer. 7
Sampled at Slutfest 3. Fucking great. Good dark brown pour with nice brown head.  Good smokey nose and roasty smokey flavor.  Very well balanced.  Badass bottle too.
Black with a off white head - smoked malt aroma - tastes of smoked malts, along with some roasted malt bitterness - good

Draft at the Surly event at Churchkey. Black pour with a big, tan head. Nose starts with that gorgeous meaty smoke character, then shifts to beautiful plum and fig dark fruit presence characteristic of the baltic porter it is, then finally finishes with dry, bitter roast at the end, with a creamy palate throughout. This progression seemed to happen on both the nose and the tongue, which was just awesome. An outstanding beer, perhaps better even than Darkness and Five which I had right next to it.
@HallingHansen tasting, thanks for sharing. Pours dark brown with a small beige head. Aroma is smoke, malt and light hay. Flavour is roasted malt, smoke and liquorish.
Bottle at RBNAG-11. Black colour with a tan head. Aroma is smoked, hop, roasted malt. Flavour is smoked, hop, alcohol, roasted malt, coffee, caramel. Nice  beer.

22oz bottle.
Black pour with some creamy tan head.  Nose reminds me of a campfire - tons of smoke, some roast, and BBQ meat.  Flavors of dark fruit, roasted malt, and smoke.  ABV is well hidden.

Had on tap at the "Power of the Pint" party. Smells like a campfire, super heavy smoke and rich malt. Taste is similar, just way too much smoke. A complex beer that I am sure will get better with age. Just too much smoke fresh.

Tap @ Avery, doing the 10th Annual Boulder Strong Ale Festival. Pours hazy dark brown with a small offwhite head. Aroma of roasted malt, smoke, campfire, cheese. Taste is roasted malt, smoke, bacon, campfire, wood, cheese. Medium body, soft carbonation. 090312

At Averys 2012 Strong Ale Fest.  Black with a small tan head. Aroma is super smoky, lots of smoke, burnt wood, charcoal char...like campfire. Flavor is smooth, but same as nose. Burnt wood, char, smoke. Smokey sweetness, and a big body. Just too smoky for me.

Draft at Churchkey. Poured a dark color, small off-whitish head. Aroma was smoke, with notes of bacon and cured meats. Flavor was smoked bacon, with notes of creamy malts. Not a great big fan of smoked beers, but this was enjoyable enough.

Super dark brown pour with a thin beige head. Massive smoke in the nose. Smoked salmon, bacon, and meat with background notes of supple but roasty chocolate. Hints of char. Caramel and molasses sweetness with big meaty smoke in the flavor, with bacon and cocoa nib in the finish. Big rich body with excellent carbonation and a dry roasty finish.

First sip had me slightly taken aback, halfway through I was really starting to love this beer, last sip had me ordering another. One of the most unique beers Ive had, has very complex notes of flavor that all shine in thier own way. Recommend trying this one if you have an open mind and can appreciate the oddity that makes it special.

Draft at The Happy Gnome. Pours black, thin tan head, spotty to poor lacing. Nose is smoke, bacon, roast, sweetness is vanilla? Coconut? Flavours of smoked salt, toasty coconut, fudge, ink. Lovely stuff!

bottle fresh in on a trade. pour is black in color with a one finger hefty brown head. aroma has smoked malt, chocolate, black coffee, and burnt sugar. mouth feel is light for such a dark beer and there is steady carbonation. flavor picks up on the smoke, chocolate, good and malty, a fair dose of hops, and light sweetness. I do not generally get into the whole smoked thing because too often it is overdone for my taste but this is well smoked but not the only thing it has to offer. the barrel aging seems to have cut the edge off things and really smoothed it out. quite interesting and the hops add another dimension. this does continue to open up as the beer goes on.

(750ml bottle from Alpar).  Pours black with garnet hues and thin espresso head. Aroma has load of savory smoke, some fruit, chocolate, light coffee.  Taste is sweet with more savory smoke.  The smoke doesnt overpower and the base beer does peek through nicely.  Light to medium bodied with a dry finish.  A fantastic beer!
Smells like a campfire and tastes like it too. Some smoked beef comes through as well. It is good, but would go great with smoked salmon or smoked cheese.
this is one delicious smoked baltic porter! pair up well with the headlight burger from Triple Rock.

From notes.  First reviewed 2/23/2011.  Poured from a 22 oz. bottle into a tasting glass.

This is pitch black with only slightly less ominous dark brown edges. Not much head, nor does it retain well or leave any lace.

The aroma is darkly roasted and burnt malts, smoke, and a little coffee and dark chocolate act as support.

Up front the flavor is sweet and roasted for a second, with dark chocolate and heavily roasted malt leading the way. Molasses, some cocoa and fruity esters, and then some smoke. A light earthy or spicy hop aroma create a bitter finish.

This actually has a body on the light side of medium, although there is a creamy side to the carbonation. 

The smoke does not dominate, which I appreciated. Overall this is another solid beer from a great brewery. I do not tend to go after the smoked beers, but I enjoyed this one.

750ml bottle from mattyb83, thanks Matt! Pours a black body with a finger-width, dense, creamy and frothy, dark brown head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing. Aroma is a really nice balance between the clean, woody peat and sweet, soft malts. Hickory smoked wood, chocolate, licorice, some dark fruits, and a light roast. Flavor is similar. Roasts and smoky peat greet the tongue before a good amount of rich chocolate malts come in. Woody throughout with some coffee, a few dark fruits, and a light licorice before the smoke, roasts, and woody peat grow slightly into the finish where this is dry and moderately bitter, but very well balanced with a creamy, rich chocolate malt. I get a little hop resin contributing to the bitterness as well. Lengthy aftertaste with just a hint of alcohol warmth following a smooth, medium body and a soft, moderate carbonation. Overall, a pretty awesome beer. Soft, easy drinking, complex, and well balanced with lots of the Baltic porter base showing up and plenty of woody peat and smoke, but not so much as to completely take over the beer. I thoroughly enjoyed this.

750 ml bottle. Dark brown, almost black body with a small but dense beige head. Aroma has lots of smoked malt with smoked meat and chocolate. Flavor is smoked, sweet malt and balanced bitterness. Medium body and lots of smoke in aftertaste. Well hidden alcohol, a very pleasant smoked beer.

At HallingHansen Grand Tasting, thanks for sharing. Pours a clear and dark beer with no head. The aroma is malt, licorice, chocolate and smoke. The flavor follows the nose. The palate is sweetness. Overall a good beer.
Black with a small off-white head. Aroma of licorice and prunes with a mild campfire smoke note. Very sweet malty flavour with a fruity touch, hard roast notes and a bit of ash in the finish
Bottle @ Hallinghansens US Tasting, Odense. Pours black with a small creamy off white head. Nose is syrup, meat and alcohol.Camfire, plastic, bacon and caramel. Smooth, slick and medium bodied.
Bottle shared by Plovmand, thanks. Dark brown body with a small head. Aroma is smoke, oak, bacon, caramel. Flavor is smoke, roasted malt, caramel.

Bottle at hallinghansen grand tasting. Pours black with a small tan head. The aroma is oak, smoke, light bacon, sweet caramel and light roast. The flavour is slightly metallic. Notes of smoke, hard roasted malt and some plastic like notes.

one of my very very high wants!! .. pours a deep brown .. great foam, lacing is thick .. . good dose of smoke, caramel, toffee, and plum skin .. . slick mouthfeel .. . i wanted a lot more smoke, but a nice brew regardless. .. . you said you liked the smell - - well im not a fish!!

Smoke pours pitch black for the most part.  Barely any head is poured at all.  Whatever pours is quickly gone to what you see in the picture to the right. 

With the smell you really dont get the full effect of this beer.  Its really not until you get to the taste that you really understand why this is called Smoke.  The smell is light on smokiness, roasted malt, chocolate, and oak.   Really nice. 

But when you take your first sip, you are really greeted by the smoke.  Smoke and burnt malt attacks the palette.  But then the beer takes a turn.  Its like a two step process.  Attack the palette with a barrage of smoke, then turn around and give us a really nice mixture of coffee, chocolate, oak, vanilla, alcohol, etc.  The ending of this beer is just fantastic.  Like I said, its  a tale of two beers here.

Love the mouthfeel.  Smooth, creamy, and just thick enough.

22oz bottle from Haskells Minneapolis.  Pours a deep brown color with a tan head.  Aroma is sweet, smokey, bacon.  Medium on the palate with soft, creamy carbonation.  Flavor is sweet, malty, smokey, ashy, tobacco, with a bitter, smokey finish.  This beer is more smokey that a lot of other smoked porters.  On the edge of overwhelming, but not quite.  Much like the rest of Surlys line.

Bottled. Black coloured. Small light Brown fluffy head. Aroma of smoke, Caramel, sweetness, chocolate. Flavour of smoke, chocolate, Rye Bread and some liqourice. Medium to full bodied. Ends sweet and chocolaty

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2012 Wonderful dark smokey beer with a full and complex aroma that manages to be both very strong and easily drinkable. Beautiful dark pour, full flavor in a relatively light body. Only drawback is the quickly disappearing head. Not many can for dark beers like Surly can.

Tasting @ Home with J&C, October 2011. Bottle from a trade with tytoanderso. Many thanks Tyler ! Very very dark brown almost black with a nice lasting brown head. Roasted malty aroma, smoke, ash,caramel, oak wood,coffee. Amazing ! Taste is amazing, at first an ice smokey blact, then comes the roasted flavours, wood,caramel. Great one !
black pour with minimal head. aroma of smoke, charred malt, and raisin. flavor of smoke and indistinct malt with little else...thin

750 ml bottle.  Pours dark brown in color with a small beige head.  The aroma has rich caramelized malts, roast, and light smoke character.  The flavor had roasted malts, caramel, smoke with a mild meaty quality as well.  The smoked character grew as it warmed.  Medium plus bodied and very smooth.  I liked the drinkability of this and would welcome another bottle.

A. This bear pours a beautiful pitch black color, with a light caramel head about 1 finger thick. It faded to a nice thin ring, with a little lily pad making its way around the center.

S. Smells of light caramel, strong bacon and of course, smoke. The bacon smell is really dominate. Almost the same as when you first set a piece into a hot pan. I can almost hear the crackle when I smell this beer :)

S. A noticeable hickory comes out first, that holds through even after your done drinking. A a smoked, almost burnt toffee taste comes through extremely smoothly. It isnt at all overbearing. The malts are noticeable, but not a dominate trait.

M. Very smooth flavor, that is not at all hard to drink. The flavor is thick and bold, but it still feels light on the tongue. Just a hint of dryness on the finish. 

O. Overall this is a complex beer, that is extremely smooth and very easy to drink. I could see spending many hours at a bar not trying anything else if this was on-tap. It delivers everything you expect from Surly. Unlike a lot of their beers that tend to take a style to its extreme, I think this hits spot on for what I would expect to see in a quality baltic porter.

This is by far one of the top beers I have ever had! It is amazingly smooth and easy to drink. The flavors are bold, but also complex. Its not a one sided smoke flavor like often what happens with Porters. The tastes changes and matures in your mouth. I look forward to having this beer again and again.

Great stuff overall.  Ive had this beer sitting around for a while without even knowing it was a baltic porter.  Really tastes great with smooth sweet roasted notes and a light smoke that is fantastic.  good stuff.

Date: January 7, 2012 Mode: Bottle Source: AV3 Description: Opaque dark brown pour with some head.  Wife is drinking this in our Surly Pint, while I got mine in my FFF XV glass.  Aroma is smoky, meaty and dark fruit (predominately raisin).  Taste starts smoky, then moves into some dark fruit then comes back with some more smoke and finishes with a little oak / wood and mild bitterness.  2011 vintage, great brew and pretty sweet bottle.
Thanks to mattyb83, amazing aroma. Big smokey aroma. Thick creamy light body. I think the lager yeast here allows you to have thick and light. Great great beer

Bottle shared by alexsdad06. Poured clear dark brown with an average brown frothy head that was mostly lasting with very good lacing. Moderate to heavytoasted smoke malt aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation. Medium to heavy sweet toasted smoked flavor with a medium to heavy sweet finish of moderate to long duration. Complex very good beer.

750 ml wax dipped bottle, 2011 vintage.  Served in a nonic pint glass, the beer pours dark brown/black with about a half inch tan head that went away quickly.  Theres a very small amount of lacing left on the glass.  The brew smells like smoked and roasted malt, peat, coffee, and a bit of chocolate.  It tastes like smoked malt/meats, burnt/charred malt, coffee, and some dark fruit and chocolate.  Mouthfeel/body is medium/full, its a little creamy and slick with low/moderate carbonation.  I think this is a pretty good brew overall, Id definitely buy this again in the future.

Appearance: pours like liquid peat and smoke under a creamy head. Fades into a lacey collar bordering a broken khaki film. Swirls bubbly.

Nose: smoke and bacon and smoke and bacon, ohmy! Smoldering fireplace, logs crackling and cracking and sparking in the back. Also in the back  cacao beans and espresso chocolate cake. Black bread and esters of horse blankets and leather. Smoked salmon?

Palate: mouthfeel is rich, creamy, smooth, bready, and cakey. Smoke is subtle and pervasive but never overwhelming. Dry finish of firewood. Smoked salmon and bacon, smoked prunes and dates, and smoke in the breath. Chocolate black cake. Peat. Dark stone fruits in the back of each and every swallow  meaty, dense, and rich. Burnt caramel. Horse and horse blankets underneath with tannin inclinations. Slowly grows more parching in the finish. Lovely.

Final Thoughts: good beer does come in a can. Oskar Blues started it and Surly continues the honorable trend of canned craft beer. The only thing that would make me happier than a can of Surly in my glass would be Surly in my glass in Florida. Surly Smoke turns its nose at the can for this particular beer though, choosing instead the waxed confines of a glass 750ml bomber. Either way, yum!

On tap at Grumpys NE, pours brown/black with a medium tan head. Aroma of smoked salted meat, chocolate and licorice. Smoke is not overwhelming in the taste yet has a solid presence, oak, chocolate, and molasses finishing with licorice. Pretty nice, alcohol is well hidden.
UPDATED: JAN 2, 2012 I could imagine this being any better.  Smoke, leather, oak.  Great carbonation... Not to thick, not to thin.  I would buy this again without hesitation.

Shared bottle @RBNAG-11. Near black, no clarity. A low creamy tan head on top. Aroma of soft, delicate sweet dark malts with a subtle smoke tone to it. Taste is soft dark malts with a refined sweetness, and a distinct but rounded smoke flavor. Creamy mf. Filling. Alcohol no option. Dangerously drinkable. Elegant and  fully ballanced. Great stuff.

Bottle shared by badnewsbeers. Deep garnet body, thin discontinuous beige head. Nose of smoke and caramel. Smoky body, like beef jerky or meat sticks, meaty and dry. Full-bodied with mostly subdued roasted notes occasionally nudging past the smoke.
Bomber from Guerde. Thanks for yet another great Surly! Pours dark brown with a few tan bubbles. Smokey bacon aroma. Full bodied. Flavor is smoke over smooth dark malt. Not burnt. Good stuff.

Bottle shared by bhensonb. Pours black with a tiny beige head and a smoky aroma. There is a hearty smoked malt flavor that sticks to the palate, and a dry slightly bitter finish. Great flavor for a lager and the smoke is not overwhelming.

Bottle from trade with arminjewell. Pours black with some red coming through. Almost no head. Aroma is suttle smoke, cinnamon, spicy earthy notes, smoked malts, blackish berry jam, sweet liquorice, sweet oak, bright chocolate, raisins and prunes. Taste is liquorice, dark sweet fruits, smoked malts, chocolate, some wood, raisins, prunes, earthy spicyness and also some roasted notes. Everything blends smooth.

Bottle shared by Rasmusott - been wanting to try this for quite a while, so its really cool to finally try it, although it did disappoint. Pours black with a red hue, not really head on this. Aroma is smokey, wood, dark berries, earthy mineral notes in the lines of the smokey component, blackberry jam, notes of pepper and cinnamon, liquorice, raisins and prunes. Rather nice aroma, although the smoke is a bit off with the earthy character. The taste resembles the smoke from the nose with these earthy mineral notes, which are kind of off.  Chocolate notes, prunes, raisins, slightly woody, but nowhere near as complex as the aroma. The lager yeast makes the mouthfeel surprisingly light, and the carbonation is very mild, could use a bit more. Glad to have tried it.
15.10.2011. 0.75l bottle.  Aroma of smoke! Brown colour. mild flavours of malt. Very much smoke.

Pours dark brown with minimal head.  Nose is all campfire smoke.  Smoke and roasted malt back with clean finish and round palate.  As it warms you get some nice dried dark fruit esters on a lingering finish-unique for the style.  Very good, cant quite say its worth the $18 price of admission, but it is unique and a good beer.

Appearance: Pours a dark brown with no head.

Aroma: Hickory smoked ham.

Taste:  Super smokey malt. Toast. Slight sour twang in the finish.

Mouthfeel:  Full bodied with modest carbonation.

Overall:  An amazing, smoky treat.

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2016 Draught @ Mikkeller Bar, Aarhus, Denmark
Pours black with a beige to tan head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, smoke, chocolate and oak. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium bitter with a long smoked, chocolate, caramel and oak finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle 750ml @ RBNAG-11
Pours dark brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, smoke, chocolate and caramel. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [7 4 6 4 14 - 3.5 11/4/2011]

0.75l bottle @ RBNAG11 bought at Cracked Kettle webshop. Pours a deep deep brown body with a nice sidesticking lightly tanned head. Aroma is light smoky and kinda beefy with tones of salty beef and smoked malts. Average carbonation with a light oily to sticky mouthfeel. Flavors are even more smoky with salty and ashy tones of dried beef. Light sweet as well. Alcohol completely hidden. A really good smoked!

Hand bottle. Pours a very dark brown colour with a thin light tan head. Aroma of smoked malt, oak, caramel and chocolate. A mildly oily mouth-feel with similar smoky, roasty flavours. Lingering caramel and chocolate. Not bad.

Bottle at Fin & Lozs tasting with Jan, Charlotte, Craig, Stella & kids consumed 22.10.11 Jan brought this along, cheers Jan.    Pours black with no head to speak of. This is smokey, really smokey in the mouth, you imagine fumes coming out of your ears and nostrils. Some smoked fish, wood smoke, really lovely.   A8 A3 T7 P4 Ov15  3.7
Shared bottle at RBNAG 11. Smoke and oak aroma. Bacon, smoke, the body feels light, and the alcohol well hidden. Overwhelming, but lovely.

Shared bottle at the RBNAG-11 grand tasting. Clear, deep mahogany with a creamy, light brown film. Smoke, wood, candy and roasted notes fills the nose. Smoky, sweet, roasted and bitter flavors with a long smoky finish that leaves the tongue dry. Full bodied.

Bottle at fins ...deep black ... light smoke ... light dark roast malt nose ... light oily body ... dark roast ... soft mellow wood smoke ...hint of toffee ... light chocolate ... nice soft chocolate roat with just the right level of smoke... andnot the wrong smoke .
65cl bottle. Pitch black colour. No head. Aroma is smoke and tar. Some bacon. Flavour is smoke, tar and bacon or some sort of smoked pig. Short aftertaste.

Sample @ RBNAG 11 (live rating). Jet black body, small beige head. Smooth tones of smoked meat, tar and peat. Taste is light sweet malty tones and cured meaty smoke tones. Hints of tar and leather. Nice.

Bottle 750ml.Clear dark red brown colour with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly to fully lasting, beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, caramel, chocolate, smoke, light wood. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a average duration, ash, caramel, chocolate, wood.
